block.p: U.S. Army investigators believe they have found the wreckage of a C.I.A. plane shot down over China 50 years ago, and they are looking for the remains of Robert C. Snoddy and Norman A. Schwartz, who were piloting a C-47 spy plane over northeast China in November 1952 in an attempt to retrieve a C.I.A. agent. The plane came under fire and the two pilots died in the crash, though two C.I.A. officers on board survived and spent 20 years in Chinese prisons.

U.S. Army investigators believe they have found the wreckage of a C.I.A. plane shot down over China 50 years ago, and they are looking for the remains of Robert C. Snoddy and Norman A. The plane came under fire and the two pilots died in the crash, though two C.I.A. officers on board survived and spent 20 years in Chinese prisons.
